projects.title: Monte Carlo Simulator
projects.description: A windows application that uses the Monte Carlo method for experimentally calculating the value of pi. Different experiment parameters can be used to see how this affects the approximation result.

projects.title: Turtle Memory Game
projects.description: A memory game where colored turtles light up in a randomly ordered pattern, then the player must click the turtles in the same order as the original pattern. The game has 20 levels, which get progressively faster as more steps are added to the pattern. I built this game in a weekend after being inspired by a very simple JavaScript based simon game I had found on CodePen.

projects.title: WWU CBE Calculator
projects.description: A chrome extension for calculating the GPAs of students in the College of Business of Economics based on specific set of classes. This was part of my senior project at WWU, and I acted as the team lead for phase 2 development, having three other students on my development team. Our team provided several bug fixes, added user-friendly printer support, updated the grade replacement rules specific based on CBE policy change, and wrote a suite of unit tests to help ensure correctness

updates.title: Introducing Elvis the Corgidor
updates.description: Welcome back to my site! Life has been a bit crazy since my last update. Between starting work at a new company, getting a new puppy, and trying to survive the pandemic, I haven't been writing as much code in my leisure time as I would like! Speaking of puppy, meet Elvis the Corgidor (Corgi + Labrador). He is a ball of energy that often distracts me from working on my math rpg game, but that is okay because he is so adorable! On the math rpg front, I will be launching a beta version of the game soon. Contact me via Linkedin or RandomocityStudios at the Gmail dot com -- you know the one.
updates.author: Wesley

updates.title: Randomocity Studios is live!
